At the end of the symposium, participants had the opportunity to ask the experts several questions and received scientific answers.

title: Sulaimani Polytechnic University (SPU) has Achieved Significant Academic Progress in the Latest Rankings of Universities by Clarivate WoS InCites.
content: In the most recent Clarivate WoS InCites report, published on January 31, 2025, which analyzes the number of citations of universities based on research published in journals indicated by Clarivate, Sulaimani Polytechnic University has earned a noteworthy ranking: 19th among all Iraqi universities. 7th place in the Kurdistan Region. 5th place among public universities in the Kurdistan Region. This ranking highlights the academic progress and research achievements of Sulaimani Polytechnic University at both the local and international levels.

title: The Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research Thanked the Director of the Career Development Center (CDC) at Sulaimani Polytechnic University for Securing First Place among Kurdistan Universities in the Skills Training Program.
content: In a letter (number 1544) dated January 21, 2025, the Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research of the Kurdistan Regional Government expressed gratitude to Ayub Karim Saeed, Director of the Career Development Center at Sulaimani Polytechnic University. The letter stated: “We would like to thank you for your responsible and dedicated performance of your daily duties and for your efforts in involving as many students and companies as possible in the internship program.” The Career Development Center at Sulaimani Polytechnic University has been ranked first among Kurdistan universities for two consecutive years in terms of student participation in internship programs. In the academic year 2022-2023, 782 students received training in private companies and institutions through CDC. The number is set to increase to 980 students in 300 private companies and institutions during the 2023-2024 academic year. In response, Mr. Ayub, Director of the CDC, said: “This recognition and appreciation is part of the success of our university. We thank the presidency of our university, deans, heads of departments, employees, and students for their contributions to this achievement.”

title: The President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University Opened the First Exhibition of Works by Students of Bakrajo Technical Institute in the New Year.
content: Supervised and attended by Prof. Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz, President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, along with several deans of colleges and institutes and government officials, opened and exhibition on Tuesday, December 21, 2025, at Bakrajo Technical Institute. The exhibition was held under the slogan “Talents and Abilities are Strengthened in the Shadow of Science” and showcased the products and efforts of students who applied their talents and the lessons they have studied. Under the supervision of their teachers, the students displayed a variety of items, including trees, handicrafts, local products, canned foods, as well as different types of honey and oils. The students expressed their hope to continue such activities, as they believe these experiences will provide them with invaluable benefits, support their future endeavors, and help them further develop their talents. They also emphasized that such events would contribute to their progress and increase their chances of securing job opportunities in the future.

title: The Career Development Center of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, in Collaboration with the American organization N2N, Conducted Two Scientific Activities
content: The first event was a 3-day international course on Mobile Application Development . This course, which took place on January 14-16, 2025, was designed for students of the College of Informatics and the Institute of Computer Science. The participants were divided into two groups. The course was taught by Alex Wong and saw the participation of 55 students. On the afternoon of Saturday, January 16, 2025, an international workshop titled “Getting Started to Dream” was held at two different times. The workshop was led by Richard Harper, an international trainer, and was attended by Prof. Dr. Diyari Ali Mohammed Amin, Dean of the Technical Institute of Computer Science, the Director of the Career Development Center, the Heads of the Scientific Departments of both institutes, as well as teachers and students from Bakrajo Technical Institute and the Institute of Computer Science. This workshop was organized by the Career Development Center of Sulaimani Polytechnic University in collaboration with N2N.

title: Supervised by Prof. Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz, President of the University, the Regular Meeting of the University Council was Held in the New Year
content: Today, Wednesday, December 8, 2025, under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz, the university council held its regular meeting for the academic year 2024–2025 in the meeting hall of the university presidency. At the beginning of the meeting, the president extended his congratulations to the university’s teachers, employees, and students on the occasion of the new year. In another part of the meeting, the president highlighted the directive from the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research to restructure the Sulaimani Technical Institute into three specialized institutes: the Sulaimani Medical Technical Institute, the Sulaimani Institute of Technology, and the Sulaimani Technical Institute of Administration. He described this development as a significant achievement for the university, contributing to the progress of Sulaimani and Kurdistan. The president also emphasized the importance of further supporting the original institute. On this occasion, he congratulated the dean, teachers, employees, and students of the Sulaimani Technical Institute. Additionally, during the same meeting, the university council discussed several topics related to scientific, student, and administrative affairs.

title: The Seventh and Eighth Rounds of Capacity Building for Students and Graduates of Universities and Institutes in the field of ICT and Cybersecurity have Successfully Conducted
content: SPU Cisco Networking Academy/ Chwar-Chra Campus in Technical College of Engineering, in collaboration with Meridian International Center and Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs of the U.S. State Department, conducted a training course for the seventh and eighth time. The program was conducted within the framework of the “IVLP Impact Awards” Program which is achieved by Asst. Prof. Dr. Awder Mohammed Ahmed, (as an IVLP Impact Awardees 2024) Head of SPU Cisco Networking Academy/ Chwar-Chra Campus, Eighty students and graduates of universities and institutes of Suleimaniyah Governorate participated in the course. Participants came from the University of Sulaimani, American University of Iraq-Sulaimani, Tishk International University, Komar University, Cihan University, University College of Goizha, Sulaimani Polytechnic University, Kurdistan Technical Institute, and National Institute. The course was delivered by a team of experts from universities in the Kurdistan Region, the United States of America, and Europe. The participants have been introduced to new programs and topics designed to help them protect against electronic attacks. They also learned essential skills that will be relevant in the future cybersecurity job market. Demand for these courses remains high among students and graduates of universities and institutes. Each announcement of such courses typically attracts 300–350 applicants, highlighting the growing importance of cybersecurity in society and its potential to help young people secure employment opportunities. Upon completing both theoretical and practical lessons, each participant received a certificate of attendance. It is worth noting that approximately 300 students and graduates from universities and institutes in the Sulaymaniyah Governorate participated in this initiative, which consisted of eight individual workshops delivered between December 2024 and January 2025.

title: The President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University Participated in the Meeting of the Presidents of Iraqi Technical Universities in Basra
content: At the request of the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research of the Federal Iraqi Government, on January 4, 2025, Prof. Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz, President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, participated in the seasonal meeting of the presidents of Iraqi technical universities, held at Southern Technical University in Basra. The meeting addressed several important topics, including greater coordination between the universities of the Iraqi government and the Kurdistan Regional Government. During the meeting, the President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University delivered a speech on behalf of the participating polytechnic universities in the Kurdistan Region, highlighting the role of these universities in continually striving to organize their education programs and align them with the labor market, ensuring that their graduates can become self-employed. In his speech, the President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University provided a brief overview of the university’s achievements, emphasizing the progress made in various fields in a short period of time. Notably, the university was ranked 4th in the Kurdistan Region, 16th in Iraq, and 2nd among Iraqi technical universities in the Times Higher Education Arab University Ranking for the first time. During his visit, the President also signed a memorandum of understanding with Prof. Dr. Adnan Abdullah Atiq, President of Southern Technical University.

title: Sulaimani Polytechnic University (SPU) has Achieved a New Success in the Field of Rankings
content: Sulaimani Polytechnic University (SPU) has been ranked first in the Kurdistan Region and seventh in Iraq by the Arab University Classification Council and the Arab Organization for Culture and Science (ARU). As part of its ongoing progress in academic internationalization, SPU has achieved a significant milestone in the latest rankings of Arab and Iraqi universities. In the 2024 ranking conducted by the Arab University Classification Council and the Arab Organization for Culture and Science (ALKSU), SPU has earned its place as a member of the Union of Arab Universities. The university ranked first in the Kurdistan Region and seventh among Iraqi universities by successfully meeting the key criteria set by ARU, which include: Education and Learning Scientific Research Innovation and Leadership Additionally, SPU demonstrated its achievements in response to questions posed by the Arab University Classification Council and ARU regarding its academic programs and activities: Offering a variety of undergraduate and postgraduate programs. Conducting several courses for primary education graduates by 2023. Introducing multiple higher education courses for graduates by the 2023 classification year. Publishing numerous research papers in Scopus between 2021 and 2023. This ranking reflects SPU’s commitment to excellence in education, research, and innovation. The Presidency of Sulaimani Polytechnic University congratulates its teachers, employees, and students on this remarkable achievement and wishes the university continued success. For more information, please visit this link:

title: Sulaimani Polytechnic University Extends its Heartfelt Congratulations on the Occasion of the Birth of Jesus Christ (peace be upon him) and the New Year.
content: On behalf of ourselves and all the teachers and employees of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, we extend our warmest congratulations to our Christian brothers and sisters in the Kurdistan Region, Sulaimani, Iraq, and around the world. We hope that this holiday season brings joy, peace, and happiness to all. For many years, Christians in the Kurdistan Region have lived in harmony, mutual respect, and love alongside Muslims and other religious communities. This enduring coexistence is a source of pride and a testament to the spirit of unity in the region. We hope that this shared bond with our Christian community continues to inspire peace, unity, and the strengthening of the spirit of coexistence. Additionally, we congratulate all citizens on the occasion of the New Year and wish everyone a joyful and peaceful holiday season. Presidency of Sulaimani Polytechnic University 24 December

title: Sulaimani Polytechnic University Participated in the Largest Conference of Admission and Registration Officials of the Arab Organization for Universities in the Sultanate of Oman
content: Muscat, Oman – The 41st Conference of Student Admission and Registration Officers of the Arab Organization for Arab Universities was held in the Sultanate of Oman on December 14th, 2024. Representing the Kurdistan Regional Government (KRG), Asst. Prof. Dr. Bakhtiar Obaid Sharif, Vice President for Student Affairs, and Dr. Rebaz Jalil, Director of the General Registry at Sulaimani Polytechnic University, participated in the conference. The event was chaired by Dr. Rahma Ibrahim Al-Mahrooqi, Minister of Higher Education, Scientific Research, and Innovation of Oman, addressed the ethical and legal challenges of ensuring the responsible use of artificial intelligence technology and explored the future of admission and registration systems. During the 4-day conference, Asst. Prof. Dr. Bakhtiar Obaid Sharif emphasized that Sulaimani Polytechnic University’s participation aligns with the university’s commitment to advancing higher education both locally and across the Arab region. He highlighted the importance of adopting modern technologies, particularly artificial intelligence, to accelerate digital transformation, improve administrative processes, and enhance student experience. He also reiterated the university’s dedication to its role as a leading academic institution, committed to preparing future leaders through strategic partnerships that foster scientific research and innovation to benefit local and regional communities. The conference featured discussions on more than 30 scientific papers and was attended by 150 experts from within and beyond the Sultanate of Oman.

title: Sulaimani Polytechnic University has been Ranked by Times Higher Education for the First Time
content: Among the progress achieved by Sulaimani Polytechnic University in the past two years, it has been ranked for the first time in 2024 by Times Higher Education. It is worth mentioning that our university Ranked 121-140 among Arab universities Ranked 16th in Iraq Ranked 4th in the Kurdistan Region Ranked second among Iraqi technical universities Ranked 1st among polytechnic universities in the Kurdistan Region This ranking is done on several different criteria for universities consisting of: Research quality International outlook Research environment Teaching Society What is noteworthy is that despite the participation of universities and submission of data for this ranking, only those universities that meet the criteria required for this ranking will be ranked. On behalf of the Presidency of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, we congratulate all the teachers, employees and students at our university and wish them further achievements and progress in the coming years with the coordination of all parties.

title: The CDC meets with the ILO
content: On December 5, 2024, the Career Development Center (CDC) of Sulaimani Polytechnic University held a meeting with representatives of the International Labor Organization (ILO) at the CDC office. The meeting was attended by Mr. Ayoob Kareem, Director of the CDC, along with several staff members from the Center. The ILO delegation included Mr. Mohamed Anas Sabee, Skills and Employability Technical officer for Jordan and Iraq, and Mr. Srood Omar, National Project Officer for the Kurdistan Region. The discussion focused on potential collaboration between the two organizations to enhance the skills of university and college students, with a particular emphasis on vocational training and preparing students for the labor market.

title: Technical College of Management of Sulaimani Polytechnic University is Organizing a Symposium on Combating Violence against Women
content: Within the framework of the 16-day campaign to combat violence against women; under the supervision and presence of Prof. Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz, President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, Asst. Prof. Dr. Bakhtiar Obaid Sharif, Vice President for Student Affairs, Prof. Dr. Hersh Rasul Murad, Dean of Technical College of Management, on 1 st of December 2024, in the Piramirdi Hall of the Presidency of the Sulaimani Polytechnic University, Technical College of Management organized a symposium under the slogan (There is no excuse for violence against women). The symposium began with a moment of silence for the souls of the victims of violence against women in particular and the martyrs in general. Afterwards, Dr. Sozi Azad Mohammed, Quality Assurance Coordinator of Technical College of Management, delivered the opening speech of the symposium, and She presented the vision of Sulaimani Polytechnic University in order to raise awareness about women’s rights. Then Miss Lavan Talib, Director of the Panel, invited the panelists to participate in their papers. Dr. Nashmil Rasul, a psychiatrist, presented a panel entitled (Domestic Violence and Psychological Stress); Brigadier Sarkawt Omar presented a panel entitled (Women’s Participation in Community Leadership, Management and Human Development). Dr. Dilpak Tahir, Director of Gender Equality Center of Sulaimani Polytechnic University presented a panel entitled (A peaceful family is the guarantee of a peaceful society) and Dr. Shakhawan Siamensuri, Chairman of the Religious Sermon Board of Sulaimani Province presented a panel entitled (What has Islam done for women?). The last panel entitled (Kurdish Media and Violence against Women) was presented by Dr. Tazhan Dilshad, Lecturer of Sulaimani Polytechnic University. The symposium ended with questions and discussions among the participants and guest panelists; Afterwards, certificates of participation were awarded to the panelists by Prof. Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz, President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University and Asst. Prof. Dr. Bakhtiar Obaid Sharif, Vice President for Student Affairs.

title: SEED Foundation, in collaboration with SPU Cisco Networking Academy/Chwar-Chra Campus, is conducting Introductory Training on Technology-Facilitated Violence.
content: For SPU students in Chwar-Chra Campus. Technology-facilitated violence can affect anyone, making digital safety more important than ever. SEED Foundation’s training offers an engaging overview of the types of online violence present in Kurdistan, practical tips for protecting yourself and your accounts, and guidance on seeking help and understanding your legal rights. Venue: SPU/Chwar-Chra Campus Date: Wednesday, December 4, 2024 Time: 10:00 AM – 11:30 AM Duration of training: 1 hour To register, please click here : Please register only if you are certain you can participate at the specified time, to ensure all spots are utilized efficiently. Note: Once your registration is completed, a confirmation email will be sent to you.

title: Sulaimani Polytechnic University (SPU) has Launched a 16-day Campaign to Combat Violence Against Women
content: On Monday, November 25, 2024, under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz, President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, the first activity of a campaign to combat violence against women was organized in Piramird Hall. The event was held under the slogan “Women are the Real Engineers of Building Life,” and was coordinated by the Directorate of Information and Activities in collaboration with the Center for Gender Equality. Prof. Dr. Ali Qadir, Vice President for Administrative and Financial Affairs, and Asst. Prof. Dr. Bakhtiar Obaid Sharif, Vice President for Student Affairs, were also present at the event. After a moment of silence for the victims of violence against women, Asst. Prof. Dr. Bakhtiar Obaid Sharif delivered a speech in which he expressed his gratitude to the university for supporting all women who stand against violence. He emphasized the importance of striving to eradicate violence and highlighted that most of the university’s composition, both in terms of students and employees, is female, with women playing a prominent role in serving the university. Later, Dr. Dilpak Tahir, Director of the Gender Equality Directorate, delivered a speech about women in the Kurdistan Region and Iraq. She urged women to remain vigilant in order to avoid facing violence and called on them to support each other, emphasizing the importance of not being the cause of violence among themselves. She also mentioned that Sulaimani Polytechnic University is currently a member of the board of the campaign to combat violence against women in Sulaimani province, thanks to the support of the university’s president for women’s rights. Finally, in celebration of the 16-day campaign against violence against women, flowers were presented to all the women working at the Presidency of Sulaimani Polytechnic University.

title: 5892 Students of Sulaimani Polytechnic University (SPU) were Awarded Graduation Certificates in a Special Ceremony
content: Today, Thursday, November 14, 2024, a graduation ceremony was held for 5892 students of Sulaimani Polytechnic University. The ceremony began with a few moments of silence for the souls of the martyrs, and then the ceremony began with the recitation of several verses from the Holy Quran. Prof. Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz, President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, delivered a speech. After welcoming the guests, he congratulated all the students and wished them a bright future. In his speech, he hoped that in the future they will play a significant role in the development of Kurdistan. He reaffirmed the support of the university to the students and said that the level of science is very advanced. He also said that as one of the most prominent scientific and technological centers in the Kurdistan Region, Sulaimani Polytechnic University has always tried to become a bridge between science and industry, between theory and practice, so you, as graduates of this university, are now part of this proud heritage. Then Dr. Amanj Abdullah Saeed, Advisor to the Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research, delivered a speech in which he congratulated the students on this holy day and thanked the university presidency, teachers and parents of the students. He also congratulated the 240th anniversary of the establishment of the city of Sulaimani. He mentioned that the university staff have worked very dedicatedly and loyally to improve the level of science in Kurdistan during their tenure in the past two and a half years. Finally, he wished success to all students. After that, the students’ representative delivered his speech and expressed his gratitude to the Presidency of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, teachers and parents of all students. Later, Asst. Prof. Dr. Bakhtiar Obaid Sharif, Vice President for Student Affairs, administered the legal oath of the students, and they promised to work hard and develop our country faithfully. Then the deans of colleges and institutes asked Prof. Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz to award certificates to their students. At the end, prizes were distributed to the first, second and third students.

title: AIDS virus HIV
content: AIDS virus HIV It is a nationwide health problem. Approximately 42.3 million people have this condition. By the end of 2023, about 39.9 million people are infected with the virus, 65% of whom are in African regions where WHO data is collected. In 2023, about 630,000 people will die from the virus and related causes, and about 1.3 million people will be infected in the same year. There is no cure for this virus, but it can be controlled by preventing the spread and by identifying and caring for the infected person. HIV attacks the body’s immune system. AIDS appears when the infection is advanced. The virus targets the body’s white blood cells and immune system, making the carrier more susceptible to diseases such as tuberculosis, some cancers, and infections. HIV is transmitted through body fluids such as blood, breastfeeding, body fluids, mother to baby, but not through hugging, kissing, or sharing drinks. It can be prevented and treated with antiretroviral therapy. When left untreated, HIV can spread to AIDS. Symptoms: In the first few weeks of infection, the symptoms are flu-like: 1) Fever 2) Headache 3) Skin sensitivity 4) Inflammation of the throat Over time, it weakens the immune system and can cause the following symptoms: 1) Lymph node infection 2) Weakness 3) Fever 4) Diarrhea 5) Cough If left untreated, people with this infection may have the following symptoms: 1) Tuberculosis 2) Meningitis 3) Acute bacterial infection 4) Cancers such as lymphoma, Kaposi’s sarcoma. It can be a worsening of some other infections such as hepatitis type (C & B) as described in previous articles. Diagnosis: – It can be diagnosed through a rapid test with same-day results. However, no test alone can diagnose the disease. Several confirmatory tests are required. The most common test used to diagnose the virus is to determine the amount of antibodies the body produces in response to HIV. If the test result is positive, a repeat test should be done to confirm the result before treatment. Tackle: – There is no cure for this virus, all that is available is to prevent the virus from multiplying in the body. Antiretroviral therapy is used throughout life to strengthen the immune system, not to cure the disease. Directorate of Health and Safety Presidency of Sulaimani Polytechnic University

title: Sulaimani Polytechnic University Celebrates the 240th Anniversary of the Establishment of Sulaimani
content: Supervised by Prof. Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz, President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, the university organized several scientific activities on the 240th anniversary of the establishment of Sulaimani, the cultural capital of the Kurdistan Region. The event, held at the Sulaimani Palace garden, featured the participation of teachers and students from both the Technical College of Engineering and the Technical College of Health and Medicine, as well as the Health and Safety Directorate of Sulaimani Polytechnic University. The Technical College of Engineering presented several scientific projects, while the Technical College of Health and Medicine and the Health and Safety Directorate organized health-related activities. These activities included screenings and information on various health conditions, such as diabetes, blood pressure, and measurements of weight and height. The participants appreciated the works of Sulaimani Polytechnic University and its students that they offered to the citizens in this anniversary.

title: The Examination of the 13th course of English Language Teaching has Started at Sulaimani Polytechnic University
content: Today the 12 th of November 2024, the first day of the exams was held at the International English Language Center. On Tuesday, under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz, President of the University, the exams of the 13th course of English language teaching began. International English Language Center of Sulaimani Polytechnic University has completed all preparations for the successful examination process of the 13th round of English language teaching. The first day of the exams was for the level (Advanced) on Tuesday, 12 November 2024 at 10 o’clock exams will be held, and the following days the levels (Intermediate), (Elementary) and (Beginner) will be held according to the names announced.

title: The Third Round of Capacity Building for Students and Graduates of Universities and Institutes in the Field of ICT and Cybersecurity has Successfully Conducted
content: SPU Cisco Networking Academy/ Chawarchra Campus in Technical College of Engineering, in collaboration with Meridian International Center and Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs of the U.S. State Department, conducted a training course. This course, conducted for the third time, trained 40 students and graduates of universities and institutes of Sulaimani city. Participants came from Tishk International University, Komar University, Cihan University, University College of Goizha, Sulaimani Polytechnic University, Kurdistan Technical Institute, and National Institute. A team of experts from universities in the Kurdistan Region, the United States of America, and Europe conducted the course. The course was led by Prof. Dr. Luo Webin of St. Mary’s University, Dr. Anastasia Apitek; a cybersecurity expert from the European Union, Asst. Prof. Dr. Sarkar Hassan from Technical College of Informatics, and Asst. Prof Mr. Awder Mohammed Ahmed of Technical College of Engineering. Upon completing both theoretical and practical lessons, each participant received a certificate of attendance. The third round of the program took place from November 16 to 19, 2024. Note: 1- The fourth round will begin on November 23, 2024. 2- The fifth and sixth rounds, which are the final rounds of the program, will be announced in December. The application link will be open for only two days due to the large number of participants. Therefore, we encourage applicants to complete the form as soon as the announcement is made.

title: Sulaimani Polytechnic University Expanding its Partnership with People’s Development Organization (PDO)
content: In order to connect the university with the community and facilitate collaboration with organisations, Sulaimani Polytechnic University, in the presence Asst. Prof. Dr. Sarhang Sarwat Hama, Vice President of Scientific Affairs and Postgraduate Studies and a number of university directors and academic staff; A joint partnership was signed with People’s Organization for Development. According to the agreement, the organization will collaborate with Sulaimani Polytechnic University in the field of awareness of women, employees and female students. Both parties intend to contribute, to the implementation of the activities relevant to the project (Masarouna) which is an advocating young people’s rights to be aware of their Sexual reproductive health and rights (RH) in inclusive societies, funded by Oxfam Novib and Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands. The overall objective of this partnership is supporting young people’s advocacy to enjoy their RH in inclusive societies. The activities include conducting RH session to the students, age 15-35 in the schools and universities in the most relevant RH topics to their ages in Sulaymaniah, Raising awareness regarding RH topics among youth through both theoretical and physical activities with supervision by a coach. The awareness about knowing the body and reproductive part until the rights can be delivered. through practical activities, it can support their mental health, improving self-esteem and well-being in collaboration with physical education department. Round tables for youth who includes (male, female), this will bring report and narrative data from participant perspective about RH in their daily life. Universities are the primary institutions for the dissemination of knowledge, through teaching, and for the generation of new knowledge, through research. These aspects make universities essential players in achieving the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Collaborating with these NG Organizations encourages universities to move towards SDGs and this partnership supports Goal 3 (SDG 3) which aims to ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all, at all ages. #sdgs #sdg #sustainability #globalgoals #sustainabledevelopmentgoals #unitednations #sdg3 #goal #health and wellbeing #wellbeing # sustainable #un #education #sustainabledevelopment #youth #impact #socialimpact #ngo #genderequality #humanrights #communitydevelopment #development.

title: Academic Journal of Sulaimani Polytechnic University (KJAR) Officially Becomes a member of CLOCKSS and Implements CrossMark on Research
content: In a new approach Kurdistan Journal of Applied Research (KJAR) published by Sulaimani Polytechnic University (SPU) has officially become a member of CLOCKSS Controlled LOCKSS (Lot of Copies Keep Stuff Safe). By participating in CLOCKSS, KJAR guarantees that its published research will be protected from any kind of data loss, technology failure, or any unforeseen circumstances. This commitment to conservation ensures that valuable research remains available to researchers around the world. This important step ensures secure archiving and long-term preservation of all publications. CLOCKSS is a very important global initiative devoted to preserving scientific content for future generations. In addition to linking to CLOCKSS, the (Crossmark) logo has been added to all studies. (Crossmark) is an essential tool that provides readers with a standardized way to verify the current status of studies or any updates, corrections, or withdrawal. This transparency is crucial for researchers who rely on accurate data for their research. Crossmark also provides a detailed history of research changes, ensuring complete transparency in the research process. Currently (KJAR) is a member of: Crossref ، Crossmark ، DOAJ ; EBSCOhost ، worldcat ؛ research4life . clockss . reviewercred /*! elementor – v3.23.0 – 05-08-2024 */ .elementor-widget-image{text-align:center}.elementor-widget-image a{display:inline-block}.elementor-widget-image a img[src$=”.svg”]{width:48px}.elementor-widget-image img{vertical-align:middle;display:inline-block}

title: British Consul General Visited Chamchamal Technical Institute
content: Today, Wednesday 23 rd of October 2024، Andrew Beasley, British Consul General in the Kurdistan Region of Iraq, accompanied by Ramk Ramazan, Governor of Chamchamal district, visited Chamchamal Technical Institute. They were welcomed by Dr. Farman Zahir Abdullah, Dean of the Institute and the Institute Council. Then a meeting was held in the presence of some organizations in Chamchamal district and representatives of the students at the institute. At the beginning, on behalf of all the teachers and students, Dr. Farman, Dean of the Institute welcomed all. Then a discussion began in which the problems of youth and students were discussed. After that, they discussed how to solve problems and serve youth and students in all fields, especially in the field of science and academia, facilitate work, provide services and find job opportunities for youth and graduates of the institute. Finally, he ended the visit with some memorable photos.

title: The English Lab Project will be Opened in the Office of the Career Development Center (CDC) at Sulaimani Polytechnic University
content: In a new scientific approach and supervised by Prof. Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz, President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, in collaboration with N2N, the project of (English Lab) was opened in the office of Career Development Center (CDC). Tuesday, 15 th of October 2024, at the Center for Career Development (CDC); In the presence of Asst. Prof. Dr. Sarhang Sarwat Hama, Vice President for Scientific Affairs and Higher Education; Julius Kogge Metuge, Director of Neighbors to Nations (N2N) Unlimited Organization; Asst. Prof. Dr.  Younis Saber Abdullah, Dean of Technical College of Health and Medicine; Mr. Ayub Karim, Director of CDC; and Dr. Hogar Mohammed Tofiq, Director of the International English Language Center and a number of department heads; opening ceremony of a new department called (English lab) was taken place. At the beginning of the ceremony, Mr. Ayub Karim thanked the President of SPU for supporting the opening of a new department in their center, and then he pointed out the importance of opening this project in preparing students for the labor market and developing the English language skills of students and graduates. In another part of the ceremony, Asst. Prof. Dr. Sarhang Sarwat Hama spoke about the coordination of Sulaimani Polytechnic University with N2N, especially after signing of the memorandum of understanding between the two sides, as well as planning for more joint work in the future. He hoped that such developments would be further expanded in the future. Julius Kogge Metuge expressed his gratitude for opening of the English Lab in Sulaimani Polytechnic University and spoke about the future plans for opening English courses in the English Lab. The activities of the English Lab include the opening of face-to-face and online English courses (Self-Study) where students and graduates of the Polytechnic University can benefit from activities to develop their English language skills.

title: The First Round of Capacity Building for Students and Graduates of Universities and Colleges in the Field of ICT and Cybersecurity has Successfully Ended
content: Academy (Cisco)- Sulaimani Polytechnic University Chawarchra Campus in Technical College of Engineering, in collaboration with Meridian International Center and the Office of Educational and Cultural Affairs of the US State Department conducted a training course for 30 graduate students from universities and colleges in Sulaimani such as International Tishk International University, Jihan University, Sulaimani Polytechnic University, Kurdistan Technical Institute and National Institute. The course was conducted by a team of experts from universities in the Kurdistan Region, the United States and Europe. Each of Prof. Dr. Luo Webin of St. Mary’s University; Dr. Anastasia Apitek, a cybersecurity expert from the European Union; Asst. Prof. Dr. Sarkar Hassan from Technical College of Informatics; and Asst. Prof Mr. Awder Mohammed Ahmed of Technical College of Engineering conducted the course. In order to pay more attention to the practical aspects of the course, IQ Company’s representative, engineer Sharo Karwan presented a lecture on cyber security. After completing all the theoretical and practical lessons, certificates were distributed to the participants who attended all the lessons. The second round of the program will resume on 13-10-2024. Students who have already applied will participate. more than 300 students and graduates of universities and colleges applied for this course in just two days, which shows the level of importance of the subject and the awareness of the applicants.

title: Sulaimani Polytechnic University is Actively Participating in the Second Annual Next Step Exhibition
content: With the participation of Deputy Prime Minister Qubad Talabani, Sulaimani Governor and Prof. Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz, President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University and a number of Presidents, teachers and students, the Next Step exhibition began its works in Sulaimani city. After a few moments of silence for the souls of the martyrs, Avin Mohammed Qadir, Secretary General of the annual exhibition of Next Step, delivered a welcoming speech; “at Next Step, we are committed to encourage and guide students towards success, not only academically but in shaping a more literate community”. Then Dr. Khatab Ahmad Mustafa, Chairman of the Higher Admission Committee of the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research read out the speech of the Minister of Higher Education, which said: “We would like to thank the organizers of this exhibition for being able to continue this exhibition for another year, through which they will provide a great service to the 12th grade graduates”. After that, Dr. Haval Abubakr, the Governor of Sulaimani mentioned that “The next step is to gather skills and experiences to get to know each other and to set the program for today and the future, which is a great and important task”. Then in an open discussion, Deputy Prime Minister Qubad Talabani talked about several aspects of the development of education and higher education: “We should pay more attention to vocational education because vocational education is the backbone of the economy. They provide the most job opportunities, so I have personally paid a lot of attention to them and helped hundreds of young people to be proud of their profession and expand their businesses.” In another part of his speech, Qubad Talabani told the successful students “You will go to university, which means that a new stage of your life will begin, and you must work harder than ever. Know that university is not the last stop, but only a bridge to start your future life”. In the first day of the exhibition, a panel entitled (Situation of Public Universities in Improving the Quality of Education) was held. Prof. Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah, President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, participated in a discussion on “Technical Education and its Problems in Polytechnic Universities in the Kurdistan Region” with Prof. Dr. Payman Ramazan, President of Raparin University; Asst. Prof. Dr. Halat Rashid, President of Charmo University; Prof. Dr. Aras Fariq, President of Garmian University. In the discussion, the president of Sulaimani Polytechnic University said that “Polytechnic universities are working to create students for the labor market; this is achieved by combining education and practical aspects. Our students lack soft skills and cannot adapt to the workplace after university and need to develop skills.” Next Step exhibition will continue from September 22 to 24, 2024 at Sulaimani Cultural Factory. The exhibition will be attended by 40 public and private universities, institutes and private sector companies. In order to serve more science and students, so that they can help graduates of grade (12) high school to choose a better future.

title: A Memorandum of Understanding was Signed between Sulaimani Polytechnic University and Al-Hadi University College
content: In order to establish coordination and strengthen scientific relations and to pay more attention to capacity development and scientific exchange, a memorandum of understanding was signed between Sulaimani Polytechnic University and Al-Hadi University College of Baghdad. On Wednesday, 2 nd of October 2024, Professor Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz, President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, received Dr. Abdul Mohsen Naji Al-Mohsen, Dean of Al-Hadi University College and his accompanying delegation. In a meeting attended by the Vice President for Scientific Affairs and Higher Education, Administration and Finance, Students’ Affairs and Director of International Relations of the University, the President expressed his pleasure with the visit and briefly talked about the history of work, achievements and activities of Sulaimani Polytechnic University that year after year takes better steps towards improving the scientific and academic level of the university in the Kurdistan Region, Iraq as well as internationally. He also said that it is very important for Iraqi institutions and universities to coordinate and have direct contacts with each other in order to exchange skills and develop the capacity of teachers and students. He also pointed out that the plan of the university is to further develop all steps, which is more about serving students at a high scientific level. The Dean of Al-Hadi University thanked the President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University for the warm welcome and hoped that this would be a good start for scientific relations and coordination between the two sides that will benefit scientists, teachers and students of the country. They also talked about their work and activities that have taken positive steps. Then the President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University and the Dean of Al-Hadi University College signed a memorandum of understanding according to which the two sides can coordinate and carry out joint scientific activities, including the development of educational programs, exchange of students and teaching staff, opening training courses, conducting scientific research and using the laboratories of both sides.

title: A Number of Our University Students are Providing Health Services to Refugees in Partnership with an American Team
content: A number of students at the Technical College of Health and Medicine of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, through the Career Development Centre (CDC), are partnering with a health team of the American organization (N2N) to provide health services to refugees in Sulaimani province. From 22 to 26/9/2024 six students from College of Health of Sulaimani Polytechnic University in the departments of (Medical Laboratory, Nursing, Anesthesia) participated as trainers and collaborators with the health team of N2N in providing health services to the refugees in Barika camp. The health team expressed their pleasure at the partnership of the Center for Career Development (CDC) in the event and promised to work together with our university. Mr. Ayub, Director of CDC announced that “This training and activity is part of the ongoing coordination between the CDC and N2N. We plan to have our students participate with these teams in the future to gain more experience and provide more services.”

title: Director of Education Programs and Quality Assurance of Sulaimani Polytechnic University will Participate in a Training Course in Germany
content: In the framework of coordination between Sulaimani Polytechnic University and Erasmus+ Partnership Program, lecturer (Shara Saleh Ali) Director of Education Programs and Quality Assurance of the University; Between 9 th Sep. 2024 to 13 th Sep. 2024, participated in a training course on the Bologna Process at the university of (TU Bergakademie, Department of Machine Elements, Engineering Design and Manufacturing, Freiberg-Germany). The course was dedicated to several important topics about the Bologna Process. Each day of the course was devoted to one of the important topics of the Bologna Process that should be followed in universities. In addition, emphasis was placed on one of the Bologna elements (ECTS). They discussed how to conduct internships, use Learning Management System and E-Learning activities in their universities, as well as the importance of Internal and External Quality Assurance that universities provide for accreditation. In another part of the course, the public library of the university was visited in order to see the study materials provided to the students at the university. This course was funded by Erasmus+- Partnership under the supervision of (Prof. Dr. Henning Zeidler, Asst. Prof. Dr. Abdulkader Ali Kadauw, organizer of the project) in coordination with (Prof. Dr. Sarkawt Rostam Hassan) Coordinator of Affairs between our university and the project.

title: The Monkeypox
content: – Monkeypox is a viral disease caused by the monkeypox virus. – The common symptoms of monkeypox are skin irritation with oral ulcers that can last for 2-4 weeks with (fever, headache, muscle pain, back pain, weakness, swollen lymph nodes). – Laboratory tests for this type of rash are by testing for skin lesions (PCR). – Vaccines and treatments used for common pox are approved to treat this type of pox in some countries. – By prohibiting contact with the person carrying this type of virus. Vaccination can help prevent infection in people at risk Anyone who gets monkeypox can be transmitted in the following ways: – Contact with an infected person (contact, kissing, etc.). – Through contact with infected animals while hunting or cooking infected animal meat. – Through contact with used belongings of infected persons. – Through an infected pregnant mother to the unborn child. History of its emergence: It was first discovered in Denmark in 1958 in the monkeys used for research. The first recorded case of monkeypox was a nine-month-old boy in Congo. Following the eradication of smallpox in the 1980s, the whole world has been vaccinated against smallpox, and monkeypox has reappeared as a substitute in central, eastern and western Africa. The global spread appeared between 2022-2023. The routes of transmission by humans as mentioned earlier are predominantly through contact and physical contact and the virus enters the body through wounded skin. Transmission of the virus from animals to humans by biting and rubbing human skin with animal hands has also been reported during hunting, trapping, cooking and eating the meat of infected animals, and playing with animals. It can be transmitted through objects and clothing, and injuries during patient care and then through beauty salons during tattoos. Symptoms: – Appears within a week or after 1-21 days. – Symptoms last for 2-4 weeks, but it may last longer in people with weakened immune systems. Common symptoms: – Skin sensitivity – Fever – Sore throat – Headache – Muscle and back pain – Weakness – Swelling of the lymph nodes The first symptom after infection can be skin sensitivity in most people, but it can vary from person to person. Skin allergy is initially just a flat wound and later develops into a watery bubble that can be painful. It can appear anywhere in the body such as: – Soles of the hands, soles of the feet. – Face, mouth and throat – Near the genitals People infected with monkeypox can still transmit the disease until their skin heals completely, and they get over the disease. Children, pregnant women, and people with weakened immune systems are at increased risk of infection. The health problems that may be encountered by the infected person include: – Pneumonia – Inflammation of the retina that causes vision loss – Pain and difficulty when swallowing food – vomiting – diarrhea – Malnutrition – Inflammation of the brain Identification and diagnosis can be as difficult as any other infection due to similarity. It is important to distinguish between (measles, chickenpox and rubella). A child suspected of monkeypox may also have chickenpox. For these reasons, it is important for people to get tested and treated early. Vaccines and treatment The goal of treating monkeypox is to address sensitivity, reduce pain and eliminate complications. Getting a monkeypox vaccine can help prevent this infection. The vaccine is given within four days of contact with an infected person or within fourteen days of having no symptoms. Health workers and people who may come into contact with infected people should get vaccinated to prevent infection. The infected person will recover within 2-4 weeks, but should take the following precautions: – Stay at home and in your room. – Wash hands with soap and water after touching the skin. – Wear masks and cover wounds outside the home. – Try to keep the skin dry and not covered at home. – Do not use water and salt to rinse the mouth during wounds. – Use painkillers for pain. Things not to do: – Do not irritate the skin and do not touch the bubbles on the skin, which causes delayed skin healing. – Hair should not be removed from the area of ​​the skin with blisters and ulcers. Directorate of Health and Safety Sulaimani Polytechnic University

title: The First Day of an International Workshop on Servant Leadership, the Power of  Words and Starting to Dream was Held
content: Today 10 th of September 2024, in the office of Career Development Center (CDC) at Sulaimani Polytechnic University in collaboration with N2N, the first day of an international workshop on servant leadership, the power of words and starting to dream was held. The workshop was taught by American trainer (Steve Jacobo). During the workshop, the trainer pointed out the characteristics of a servant leader as a successful model for management, and the participants enriched the discussion with their comments. Within the framework of the same workshop, on Thursday 12/9/2024 the topic (Power of Words) and on Saturday 16/9/2024 the topic (Getting Started to Dream) will be presented.

title: Sulaimani Polytechnic University (SPU) is Opening a Course on Combating Drugs and Psychotropic Substances for its Teachers
content: For the first time and with the participation of more than (50) teachers from all colleges and institutes and under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz, President of the University and in the presence of Dr. Bakhtiar Obaid Sharif, Vice President for Student Affairs and Chairman of the High Committee to Combat Drugs and Psychotropic Substances on 12 th of September 2024, in Nali Hall; Sulaimani Polytechnic University (SPU) has launched a national campaign against drugs and psychotropic substances. Dr. Bakhtiar Obaid Sharif presented the views of the Presidency of Sulaimani Polytechnic University on the dangers and effects of drugs to distort and dissolve families, destroy of youth and waste of the country’s economy to the teachers. In this regard, it was recommended that the first lesson in the new academic season would be devoted to highlighting this danger. He also pointed out the next steps of the university to make the efforts of the campaign against drugs and psychotropic substances a success. Then in four lessons each of Dr. Ahmad Mohammed Amin Ahmad Lecturer at Sulaimani Polytechnic University / Technical College of Health and Medicine; Judge Dr. Awat Omar Qadir, President of Court of Appeal of Kirkuk District – Garmian; Colonel Ismail Osman Omar, an officer in the Directorate of Drugs; and Mr. Ayub Karim Saeed, Director of Career Development Center (CDC) at Sulaimani Polytechnic University, discussed in detail the dangers of the spread and use of drugs and their psychological effects on family social security, health, economy and education. The course teachers also presented the applicable legal measures to combat this threat. They considered it important to raise awareness among individuals in society, especially among students. After the presentation of the lectures Finally, appreciations were presented to the lecturers of the course by Dr. Bakhtiar Obaid Sharif, Vice President for Student Affairs and Chairman of the High Committee for Combating Drugs and Psychotropic Substances.

title: Definition and Interpretation of the New Logo Symbols of Sulaimani Polytechnic University
content: – Red color in the logo of Sulaimani Polytechnic University means to encourage and active participation of students used to create an atmosphere of cooperation, coordination, discussion and innovation within the framework of the educational process. – The use of saturated blue is a sign of the commitment of Sulaimani Polytechnic University to continue scientific and intellectual efforts in all fields in order to achieve academic and scientific capacity at the level of international academic scientific centers. The use of saturated blue is also considered a professional symbol of intelligence and experience. The gear in the logo of Sulaimani Polytechnic University is a symbol of technical education. – The symbols of altitude in the shape of mountains used in the logo are a symbol of Kurdistan’s nature, the strength and ability to resist that the sunlight spreads throughout the logo from the foothills of the mountains. The number of mountains also reflects the number of university colleges and institutes. – 1996 marks the year of the establishment of the Board of Technical Education, which later changed to Sulaimani Polytechnic University in 2012.

title: The US Consul General in Erbil Visits Sulaimani Polytechnic University
content: This morning, 25 th of July 2024, the US Consul General in Erbil Mark Stroh and his team visited Sulaimani Polytechnic University, Technical College of Engineering. On behalf of the President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, Asst. Prof. Dr. Sarhang Sarwat Hama Karim, Vice President for Scientific Affairs and Higher Education along with Asst. Prof. Dr. Sivan Hisham Tahir, Dean of Technical College of Engineering and Asst. Prof. Mr. Awder Mohammed, Director of International Relations warmly welcomed them. The purpose of their visit was to get a closer look at the opening of the Cisco Academy, which will soon serve students and teachers of our university and will also become an academic and practical center for training in the field of networking. Another part of the interview was dedicated to discussing several scientific issues related to further serving the university, teachers and students of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, which several new projects will be implemented in the near future.

title: Viruses
content: Viruses are small germs( pathogens) that can infect you and make you sick. They can infect humans, plants, animals, bacteria and fungi. Each one infects only specific types of hosts. Viral infections in humans can cause no symptoms or make you extremely ill. Viruses aren’t made up of cells , so they don’t have alle the equipment that cell do to make more copies of themselves. Instead, they carry instructions with them and use a host cell’s equipment to make more copies of the virus. What are some diseases caused by viruses? 1. Respiratory illnesses 2. Diarrhea and vomiting 3. Sexually transmitted infections (STIs). 4. Skin conditions 5. The flu ( influenza) 6. Corona 7. Chickenpox 8. Measles 9. Rabies 10. Hepatitis Virus features 1.Are made up of genetic material ( RNA ir DNA) and a protective protein coating ( capsid) 2.Are similar to parasites- they need a host to reproduce. They’ll survive outside of a host until their capsid breaks down over time. 3.Are 100 to 1000 times smaller than the cells in your body. How do viruses get into your body? Viruses usually enter your body through your mucous membranes. These include your eyes, nose, mouth, reproductive organs. Some viruses get kn through a break in your skin or from a bite from a mosquito or tick. Are viruses living or nonliving? There’s some debate over this. Generally, biologists don’t consider viruses to be alive because they can’t perform the functions that living organisms do. For instance, they can’t convert food into energy, and they can’t live or reproduce without a host cell. Types of viruses; Experts group viruses into categories based on similar features, like size, shape and the types of genetic material they carry: 1.Hepatitis viruses 2.HIV 3.Influenza viruses 4.Coronavirus

In addition, out of 31 public and private universities in the Kurdistan region, our university ranked 10 th . Also, it was ranked eighth among public universities.

title: Social Relations and Health Effects
content: Dozens of studies have shown that; People who have secure and satisfying relationships with family, friends, and community members are happier, have fewer health problems, and live longer. This is due to the fact that, by nature, a human being is a social creature, so this social being often becomes supportive and helpful and gives him/her a sense of connection. Scientists have found that socializing helps reduce harmful levels of stress, while chronic stress can damage our physical and mental health. On the contrary, caring for others reduces stress-producing hormones on both sides (Receiver and Donor). Reducing stress is not the only health benefit of having social relationships, but we can learn many healthy habits from those around us and develop them in ourselves. Some of the situations that can be caused by lack of good social relationships: depression and anxiety Increased levels of stress and inflammation, which can adversely affect blood vessels, bowel function, insulin regulation and the immune system heart disease and cancer Late (delayed) recovery from injury, surgery and illness. Premature death How to build and develop social relationships? Start with the relationships you have, through visiting people; for example, contacting, asking about and visiting them. Try to get closer to your colleagues and make them your friends by finding common ground. Participate in group activities that give you the opportunity to meet others. Participation in volunteer work. Health and Safety Awareness Team Directorate of Health and Safety

title: A Committee of Dean and Teachers of Bakrajo Technical Institute Visited Universities in Germany
content: Under the supervision of Professor Dr. Hoshyar Abdullah Aziz, President of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, in the continuation of the work and activities of the Scientific Coordination and Relations Committee of the Institute, on the official invitation of several German universities, and in order to exchange science and establish relations between Sulaimani Polytechnic University and universities abroad, Asst. Prof. Dr. Kawa Raza, Dean of the Institute and teachers of the Institute, Miss. Evin Aladdin, Mr. Goran Salam and Miss. Nyan Jalal, visited ( Weihenstephan- Triesdorf University ). During the visit, the President of the University; Professor Schlauder Ralph, warmly welcomed them and appreciated their visit. The visit lasted three days, and it was held on 3-6-2024. During their visit, the committee visited the classrooms, laboratories and experimental units of the university and then presented a seminar on the introduction of Sulaimani Polytechnic University in the Kurdistan Region.

title: The (Times Higher Education) has Published an Impact Ranking and Sulaimani Polytechnic University is Ranked Fourth among Public Universities
content: On 12 th of June 2024, the Times Higher Education Foundation has announced an ( Impact Ranking ), and for the first time Sulaimani Polytechnic University participated and was able to record a good level, in which at the level of Iraqi universities, it is 62 nd, at the regional level it is 8 th, and at the level of public universities in the region, our university is ranked 4 th . According to the impact ranking for 2024; (9) Public and private universities in the Kurdistan Region are in the ranking. Compared to 2023, only three universities in the Kurdistan Region were in this ranking. In 2023, Sulaimani Polytechnic University provided the necessary data for this ranking, and it has made great progress in meeting the requirements of this ranking. On behalf of the Presidency of Sulaimani Polytechnic University, we congratulate all teachers, employees and students of our university for this progress. What is meant by “Impact or Sustainability Ranking” in universities? The SDGs are a call for all countries (poor, rich and middle class) to promote welfare while protecting our planet and ending poverty. This must go hand in hand with strategic plans, build economic growth and address social needs; These include education, health, social protection and employment. At the same time, countries must address climate change and environmental protection. The (17) goals known as the (SDGs) which are set by the United Nations for universities, are to determine the role of universities in serving society and humanity. For this purpose, universities should carry out a number of activities annually to serve these areas. The activities included in the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) adopted by all UN members in 2015 created (17) Global Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) which include: Poverty Eradication (SDG 1) End Hunger (SDG 2) Providing good health and well-being (SDG 3) Quality Education (SDG 4) Gender Equality (SDG 5) Clean Water and Sanitation (SDG 6) Affordable and Clean Energy (SDG 7) Decent Work and Economic Growth (SDG 8) Industrialization, Innovation and Infrastructure Development (SDG 9) Reducing Inequality (SDG 10) Sustainable Cities and Communities (SDG 11) Responsible Consumption and Production (SDG 12) Responsibility for Climate (SDG 13) Protect Underwater Life (SDG 14) Protecting Life on Earth (SDG 15) Provide peace, justice, and strong institutions (SDG 16) Global partnerships to achieve the goals (SDG 17) For the first time in 2023, Sulaimani Polytechnic University (SPU) has submitted the necessary data in this type of ranking which is called (Impact Ranking) and run by the institution (Times Higher Education).

title: Sulaimani Polytechnic University (SPU) has been Included in the Latest Clarivate Rankings for Universities for the First Time
content: In the latest publications of Clarivate website, Sulaimani Polytechnic University is ranked 16th in the Iraqi universities in the ( InCite-WoS ) report for the years 2019-2023 and 6th in the Kurdistan Region. At the level of public universities, our university is ranked 4th. This is the sum of five years of all research presented during that period. It is worth mentioning that (Clarivate Wos Incite) is a platform developed by Clarivate Analytics that provides access to scientific resources, tracks the number of citations and evaluates the impact of their scientific publications. Sulaimani Polytechnic University is participating in this ranking for the first time and has achieved a good ranking at the level of universities in the Kurdistan Region and Iraq.

title: Graduate Student of Sulaimani Polytechnic University in China will Participate in the 11th Scientific Conference of Xiangya School of Nursing
content: Raghda Kamaran Abdulmohsen, a lecturer at the Technical College of Health and Medicine, as a higher education student and as the only Kurd, participated in the 11th Scientific Conference of Xiangya School of Nursing in China. The conference was held under the title (11t Xiangya International Academic Nursing Conference on Interdisciplinary Innovation and High-Level Talent Development). The two-day conference was held on the occasion of the 110th anniversary of the university’s establishment. The conference featured several new ideas in the field of health in general and nursing in particular, and several universities in China and abroad participated in the conference.

Dr. Sarhang Sarwat Hama, Vice President for Scientific and Higher Education Affairs has welcomed Prof. Dr. Kosar Mohammed Ali, President of Sulaimani University ; Prof. Dr. Omid Rafiq Fatah, President of Cihan University /Sulaimani; and Prof. Dr. Kawa Jamal, Vice President of Sulaimani University for Administrative and Financial Affairs. content: On 22 nd of May 2024, the first day of the workshop of the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research entitled (Knowledge, Skills and Competencies) in the curricula of universities, colleges and institutes of the Kurdistan Region was held by universities, colleges, and institutes in Sulaimani and its surrounding areas.
